comment.author: 22139308@N03
comment._content: Sport, Olympic Games 1928, Amsterdam. Field hockey match France-Spain (2-1). (As a Canadian, I can't just call it hockey ;))

comment.author: 24320600@N04
comment._content:
(I thought hockey in Canada meant ice-hockey - Canucks, Leafs, etc.)

Great picture - looks like the referee (if that's what the middle guy is, is nearsighted!

Great to see all these pictures - thank you, Nationaal Archief!

comment.author: 22139308@N03
comment._content: Yes, you're correct. Canadians will call the sport above "field hockey" to distinguish it from "ice hockey", which is simply called "hockey" in Canada.

comment.author: 26022992@N07
comment._content:
Pieter van Kweirk heads for the finishing line in the 50k walking race.
Note: this was the day after the race officially finished, hence the bemused looks on the faces of the French and Spanish hockey team who are trying to get on with their match.
